message:
No water damage per customer 

Amber light on charger

PPBUS_G3H at 1.94V
CPU WARM

Obvious;y no fan spin

U7100:
1: 0V
2: 14.59
3: 3.94
7: 1.17V
8: .326
9: .1
10: 3.43
12: 3.43
13: 3.40
14: 3.40
15: 0.06
16: 1.95
17: 1.95
18: 1.95
19: 5.01
20: 5.0
23: 1.97
24: 2.57
25: 6.52
26: 14.19
27: 14.41
28: 14.41

RES: 27-28: 20 O
RES 17-18: 3.5 O

Q7130
1: 2.57V
8: 4.11V
10: 1.97   and 0.3 ohm to ground

10: .20 V to ground in diode mode
9: no short to ground

so am I short to ground on PPBUS_G3H here?

corrosion on u7400 and u7600
replaced them both with new chips

"10: 1.97   and 0.3 ohm to ground"
Any big coil with the same value to ground?
Apart of L7130, of course...

I'm not sure how do you measure voltage, but 1.97V on 0.3 ohm to ground is IMPOSSIBLE.

ok my f up

1.97V
215  O to ground

R7120= .1 OHMS
14 V on Pin 1 



WENT BACK TO U7100
PIN 24 2.57 V and 103 OHM to ground

On a working refernce board:
PIN 24 is 10.5 V and 2 MOhm to ground
Change U7100 and Q7130, just in case.

did it
no change

PPBUS_G3H is NOT 0V
It remains 1.96 V
it is being dragged down

CPU IS WARM

My thought:

D7105
Q7180 but I am getting 14V at pin 2 R7120

Post again diode mode to ground at L7130, when F7140 is soldered.
Measure with red probe connected to ground.

L7130. ----> 0.117V to Ground pin 1 & 2

[URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-3435-ppbus-1-7v.48210/[/URL]



i should have measured resistance to ground with u7100 removed
i used a brand new U7100 ISL chip too

When you have a PPBUS_G3H low voltage how the hell do you tell if this is a load side or line side issue?
L7130. ----> 0.117V to Ground pin 1 & 2

That is good value; if measured with red probe at ground.

Post again U7100 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

OK I will post voltages
I may change the chip
I had used a Chinese chip from Alibaba

I have a US supplier.
Maybe the chip is bad

Measured with F7140 in place?
Is the fuse good?

Did you solder good Q7130?

Change C7125 and Q7130.

done
fuse is good: RESISTANCE is 0.7 ohms


AS A TEST:

removed f7140

0.2V diode to ground pin 1
open on pin 2

THEN OUT BACK F7140

give up on this board?

Changed C1212 as it looked bad and was heating to touch
C1214 VERY WARM but looks OK
L7130 voltage, when F7140 removed?

L7130 voltage back 8.59V (PIN 1&2) with F7140 removed

Short is on the system side
U7100 is outputting PPBUS_G3H

U5450

PIN 3: 2.5 kO
PIN 4&5: 100OHM in diode mode to ground
PIN 6: 19 kO

Diode mode voltage drop to ground on pins 1&2 of L7310 and L7320 is 0 V

Noted Q5510 case cracked open
Replaced

No change
No fan spin

Q5500
PIN 4: 0.07V diode to ground
PIN 4: 185Ohm to ground

replaced, no change

oh well

So you wasted time with good working charger circuit...

Exact diode mode to ground on PPBUS_G3H?
Measure in both ways; red and also black at ground.
Compare values with all big coils.
why is resistance so low on cpu inductors ?

swapped Q7630, no change
going to look at U7600 now

could the inductor itself be bad?

also C7630 or R7630 to check

"swapped Q7630, no change"
No change what???
Post diode mode at PPBUS_G3H now.
You should get normal values, after changing Q7630.

"L7310                                     0.000                                       0.000
L7320                                     0.000                                       0.000"
I forgot them; if real, dead CPU more likely.

OK sorry informaticos.
That was a stupid post.
Swapped Q7630.


PPBUS_G3H: 8.59V
DIODE MODE PPBUS_G3H: 2.86 V to GROUND
OHM MODE: 1.59 MOhm to ground



Checked all prior solder work

Plug in nothing, plug in again...nothing..plug in gain...fan spin...
Intermittent fan spin
Fan spin..stop..Fan spin--stop---> keeps going

Though it may be the DC in board--> swapped...intermittent fan spin
Though it may be the LIO cable--> swapped...intermittent fan spin

So 8.6V stable now at PPBUS_G3H?
Check if all voltages appear when fan spin.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Test the board alone on the desk, without any flex connected; nor LIO flex, just DCIN 5 pins cable.

Voltage pulse on then off:

Board now only fan spins once then stops
If I plug the magsafe in and out it does it again:

Cannot start in SMC bypass mode.

Tested the board alone on the desk, without any flex connected; nor LIO flex, just DCIN 5 pins cable.

L7630: 1.05 V --> 0
L7620: 5.09 V
L7430:1.20V
L7560: 3.34V
L7750: 5.09V

THe coils pulse x 1

if it’s pulsing smc is good no?
cpu rail 0v

could this be a sensor issue?
Post U1950 voltage readings when fan spins.

u1950 area is ugly on this board
bare pcb ground plane to the right on the pin 1/8 side of chip exposed

i think i have soldered and resoldered that chip 5 times

[ATTACH type="full"]59479[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH type="full"]59480[/ATTACH]
Pin 3 goes high when fan spins?
Yes: 1.66V when fan spins
Fix the problem, MUST be 3V.

Working on it.

REFLOWED U1950 again

Fan spins...4 sec..stop...spin...stop

U1950
1: ALL_SYS_PWRGD: 3.33V steady
2: 3.33V and steady

PIN 3: 0.25-0.30,1.60,0.25 -----> 2.5V diode mode to ground pin 3

Flip board over onto CPU side.
Fan now spins and stays spinning only to return to the start.stop.start stop pattern

Something is f'd up.
If PIN 2 is 3.33 V then the CPU is not dead correct?
You must get 3V at pins 5, 6, 3.
